intro: Himatanthus attenuatus var. malongo, commonly known as the Malongo star apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a unique, star-shaped fruit with a sweet, aromatic pulp that has a texture similar to a pear. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The fruit is often consumed fresh or used in culinary applications due to its distinct flavor.
